intro: Machaeranthera canescens var. shastensis, commonly known as Shasta blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, grayish foliage and produces showy composite flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to the typical form of Machaeranthera canescens.
